items.title: These States Want People to Pay in Cash to Get Out of Jail
items.description: Encouraged by Trump, some lawmakers are championing cash bail, undercutting reforms that advocates say made the system fairer for poor people.

items.title: The Marshall Project Honored With Multiple Journalism Awards
items.description: Honors hail from the Institute for Nonprofit News, the Online News Association, and NLGJA: The Association of LGBTQ+ Journalists.

items.title: How Missouri Has Let Police Officers Stay Licensed After Serious Misconduct
items.description: Missouri’s system often takes years to resolve a misconduct allegation, in some cases allowing officers to move on to a new department.

items.title: A Mississippi Prison Murder Indictment Was Forgotten for 3 Years — Until a Reporter Called
items.description: John Lowe was beaten to death in a prison shower in 2021, but the murder suspect was not served the indictment because of bureaucratic missteps.

items.title: An Illustrated Resource Guide for Families of Homicide Victims in St. Louis
items.description: The Marshall Project compiled guidance on grieving, working with law enforcement and more from those who have lost someone to violence.
